utterance: CM: The good thing about moleculars are that they're more selective for single things and you can tune them but then the bad thing is there are issues with stability and and things like that, leeching, stuff like that. So you can suddenly make like and I guess I mean um you know, you know, this is sort of known in the molecular world, but uh you know, I guess the heterogeneous catalysis is catching up to it, right? That uh that you suddenly have one, you know, iron becoming like platinum or or or like gold. And and so then you can have cheaper single atoms even uh that give you the same sort of functionality. And the design space now is almost unlimited, right? You can now do single atom alloy catalyst. So like like two atom alloys. Um and then and of course whatever is the host uh support uh that is hosting that single atom anchor. Um and I think now uh it's at the point where the single atom density. utterance: MH: One thing that I think like to go back to the prompt, um which is um yeah, there are two hubs of.
